You may not work on campus after completing your studies, unless the position meets the requirements of Optional Practical Training or J-1 Academic Training.   F-1 students should read information about post-completion Optional Practical Training , and J-1 students should read the information about Academic Training to learn more about employment after graduation.                              Need to report a change while on        post-completion OPT?                   Update your address, employer, status information and more.            Click here.                                                        Cap Gap Extension                  Are you an F-1 student on post-completion OPT and your employer has filed an H-1B change of status on your behalf?              Learn about this special extension                                   STEM OPT                  Are you an F-1 student in one of the STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics) fields?              Learn more to see if you qualify for the 17 month STEM OPT extension                                                       NYU Footer          Search      Directory      Campus Map      Events      Contact Us      Site Map      Copyright and Fair Use      Feedback         Unless otherwise noted, all content copyright New York University. Navigating and choosing a private school option can be costly both in terms of time and money. Clarifying and understanding the admissions process, as well as understanding the resources that are available to support families in reducing tuition costs, can make the process less stressful.   In this section you will find detailed information about independent private school options from nursery school to high school. Use the navigation on your left to find guidance on evaluating and identifying schools that are a good fit for your child, the admissions process, timelines, and more. Wagner Graduate School of Public Service      School of Continuing and Professional Studies      School of Law      School of Medicine      Silver School of Social Work      Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development      Tisch School of the Arts                                         Search        go                                                               New York University              New York University              Office of the Bursar                                                         eSuite Information                                        Payment Information                               Steps to Take After Registering                          Account Balance                          Financial Clearance                          Payment Deadline Dates                          Payment Plans                           Methods of Payment                                Electronic Check                                Personal Check                                Wire Transfer                                  Third Party Payment                                Tuition Remission                                529 Plan                                                                                  Loans and NY State Tap Awards                                     Tuition and Fees                                     Your Account                                     Refunds                                      Tax Topics                                           Forms                                           Services                                               Home        |        Payment Information                 |         Methods of Payment                                                           The balance due on your Statement of Account can be paid with electronic checks, personal checks, bank drafts, money orders, and/or wire transfers. If your account requires payment by certified check or money order, you may not make payment by electronic check.                    Electronic Check            Personal Check          Wire Transfer (for students who do not have a U.S. checking account)      Third Party Payment      Tuition Remission      529 plan mailing information                   *Please Note: Credit Cards are no longer accepted as a method of paying charges on your student bill as of December 1, 2010.
